NYU's Administration is committed to providing faculty, research staff and administrative support staff with the tools necessary to perform the various research administration functions required to ensure the responsible stewardship of extramural funds.     Partnerships between central support units, including Sponsored Programs Accounting & the Office of Sponsored Programs, the Contracts Office, and others to assess the needs of our campus, develop and deliver training workshops, on-line tutorials, and other opportunities for professional development.   Check out our site often, as it is a work in progress that we expect will continue to evolve in response to the changing environment within which NYU research administrators operate.        Research Administration Training         Training in Research Administration Certificate (TRAC) Program   Responsible Conduct of Research   Office of Veterinary Resources   Human Subjects Tutorial   Controller's Division Training     Research Training Resources     Office of Sponsored Programs Training Materials   NIH Webinar     NCURA YouTube Channel     Responsible Conduct of Research Resources          Resources     The following are links to sites which contain helpful information as it relates to Pre-Award proposal development, as well as links to professional organizations through which you can connect with your research administration collegues across the country.   Links and References     Center for Scientific Review "What Happens to Your Grant Application: A Primer for New Applicants"   "Inside the NIH Grant Review Process" video   Advice to Investigators Submitting Clinical Research Applications   Academic Scientists Toolkit   NYU ITS Research Computing Website     Research Administration Professional Organizations       National Council of University Research Administrators (NCURA)   Society for Research Administrators (SRA)                                              Conflict of Interest        Required Training                                                             Inquiries about trainings? For more information, please visit the    NYU Classes Training and Support site .      Faculty and Staff   Visit the NYU Classes Getting Started Page    to setup your course sites and learn the basics of the new system.   Students   See an    overview of the new system  and find links to helpful documentation.         Individual and Small Group Consultations   Looking for individualized help for yourself or a small group of your colleagues? One-on-one and small group consultations can be scheduled with the NYU Classes support team.    Click here to schedule a time .     To learn about additional training opportunities at NYU Global Academic Centers, please contact    AskITS@nyu.edu . For immediate assistance with an IT-related question, contact the      IT Service Desk or browse the ServiceLink knowledge base .      For a current list of Libraries classes and tours, visit     the NYU Libraries website .                NYU IT offers a variety of training options for the NYU community, including tutorials, in-person sessions, and occasional classes in the University's online training system, NYUiLearn.    See the links below for service-specific offerings, or explore NYU ServiceLink for self-guided support and training on a wide range of NYU IT services.     Advanced Media Studio consultations   Data Services tutorials: statistics, GIS mapping & more   Faculty Digital Archive   lynda.com   NYU Classes   NYU Google Apps for Education (including NYU Calendar, NYU Drive, NYU Email, NYU Groups, NYU Sites, and more)   NYU Lists   NYU Print Service   NYU Stream   NYU Survey Service (Qualtrics)   NYU Wikis   Telephones & voice mail   Web Publishing            There is no charge for any instructional sessions, but participants should bring a valid NYUCard to in-person classes and workshops.    Training by Request   NYU Information Technology   NYU IT may be able to arrange special training by request for NYU departments, classes, and organizations.      To request training in NYU-supported services not covered in the trainings and workshops listed above, send email to    AskITS@nyu.edu . Include your name,   NYU affiliation, desired topic of class, desired location, and the anticipated number of attendees. If training is available, an NYU IT representative will contact you to arrange a date and time that will be convenient for your group.    For special classes in statistics or mapping software, fill out the NYU Libraries'    Request an instruction session form or call Data Services at 1-212-998-3434.    For training in other software applications, contact the Digital Studio .      NYU Libraries   Bobst Library has subject specialists in many areas of study that support the University's curriculum. NYU faculty can make arrangements for advanced and subject-specific classes by filling out the NYU Libraries' Request an instruction session form. Advanced students needing in-depth reference assistance with primary sources, unpublished, archival and foreign materials, or doctoral research can  also make appointments with a subject specialist. For contact information, visit:   http://library.nyu.edu/research/lib_arc.html or fill out the   subject specialist contact form .    NYUiLearn IT Classes   Periodically, IT classes for NYU staff and faculty are available via NYUiLearn . To view class descriptions and register for sessions, when available:    Sign into NYUHome ( home.nyu.edu ) and go to the Work tab.  Click the NYUiLearn Login button within the NYUiLearn channel (may be towards the bottom of the page).  To see current IT class offerings, click Course Catalog and select Technology from the Category drop-down menu in the right corner.    Note : NYUiLearn is not currently available to NYU students; see the links above for other training resources.    Page last reviewed: October 17, 2014
